ru.jango.j0loader.image

Class AsyncImageView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.RelativeLayout
          • ru.jango.j0loader.image.AsyncImageView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public class AsyncImageView
extends android.widget.RelativeLayout
    Special extension of ImageView that could be used with ImageLoader. Also it automatically draws a special drawing indicator while listening to DataLoader.LoadingListener.downloadingUpdateProgress(ru.jango.j0loader.Request, long, long).

    ATTENTION: Automatically removes itself from ImageLoader's listeners when is removed from interface (in onDetachedFromWindow() calls setImageLoader(ImageLoader) with NULL). So when using it in ListView basically everything goes well, but just in case pay attention and use setAutoDetachLoader(boolean) or manually reset ImageLoader via setImageLoader(ImageLoader) on each Adapter.getView(int, android.view.View, android.view.ViewGroup) call.

      • setImageLoader

        public void setImageLoader(ImageLoader loader)
        Switches view on new ImageLoader. Automatically removes itself from old loader's listeners collection and adds itself to new loader's listeners collection.
        Parameters:
        loader - new ImageLoader, may be NULL

      • shouldAutoDetachLoader

        public boolean shouldAutoDetachLoader()
        AsyncImageView automatically removes itself from ImageLoader's listeners when is removed from interface (in onDetachedFromWindow() calls setImageLoader(ImageLoader) with NULL). To avoid this - use setAutoDetachLoader(boolean) with FALSE param.

      • setAutoDetachLoader

        public void setAutoDetachLoader(boolean autoDetachLoader)
        AsyncImageView automatically removes itself from ImageLoader's listeners when is removed from interface (in onDetachedFromWindow() calls setImageLoader(ImageLoader) with NULL). To avoid this - use this method with FALSE param.
